author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an upper-case letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are upper-case.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: DefaultKeywordArguments, Distributions, LaTeXStrings, LogExpFunctions, Plots, Reexport
- Package name similar to 14 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to Cxx. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.
  2. Similar to Cbc. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.
  3. Similar to UCX. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 1.95 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  4. Similar to CSV. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to CRC. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to BBI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to C3D. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to TCX. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to CBFV. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to CBLS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to XCB. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to Clp. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to COBS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  14. Similar to CBOR. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) to ask for help. Include a link to this pull request.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

The name `ConsensusBasedOptimization` seems like it should be okay for this. A short, non-common acronym like `CBX` isn't going to work, I'm afraid. Not even with an existing [CBXpy](https://github.com/PdIPS/CBXpy) package. You might still be able to use the "CBX" branding by having `CBX` be a submodule of `ConsensusBasedOptimization` so that the package can be loaded as `using ConsensusBasedOptimization: CBX`, or something like that.

body:
